author: terencechain
content: Two things that come to mind are that the column sidecar already includes the signed block header, and I don't think we get downscored for requesting column sidecars by root if the peer doesn't have them

author: jimmygchen
content: We're focusing on sync right now as we feel having robust sync implementation is critical to a stable network and right now it's quite brittle.  We won't be able to make much progress on validator custody in the next ~2 weeks at least.

author: agnxsh
content: Overall testing backfill and column syncing was an issue that I kept pressing for the last couple months, Nimbus is still prioritising on testing robustness of that over finishing up validator custody. You can expect a working & backfilling validator custody in the next 7-10 days

author: agnxsh
content: We are already supporting it if people agree we can have it active on devnet 7

author: barnabasbusa
content: Is there a point in launching devnet 7 if all clients are still deep into fixing syncing issues and validator custody?

author: barnabasbusa
content: I have a feeling we would have a similarly failed devnet if we just launched devnet 7 just for sake of launching it

author: agnxsh
content: Yes imo, we need more stability and certainty of getBlobsV2 and payloadV5

author: agnxsh
content: I donâ€™t think so look at the sunnyside network

author: agnxsh
content: Last i checked itâ€™s going really well

author: agnxsh
content: Except some minor bugs

author: jimmygchen
content: would be useful to have a devnet for sync and interop testing, but i guess people are using the sunnyside devnet rn?

author: agnxsh
content: Yeah overall true, I genuinely need a larger longer running devnet to test syncing, devnet 5 was a good one to test, there was really decent column availability, i think we should let sunnyside network keep running atleast for the next 3 weeks

author: __flcl
content: Maybe rebalance validator counts towards more stable implementations and relaunch devnet-6 (or everyone's heavy WIP?)

author: agnxsh
content: Difficult to say from last net as ELs went OOM last devnet/ devnet 6

author: mininny
content: If you guys need to test bugfixes and more stable implementations (before the actual devnet-7 or fusaka-1 with mostly all bugs removed), we can continue using sunnyside devnet and use it like regular devnet since it has decent history for sync tests as well

author: agnxsh
content: I recommend to keep the network for atleast 3 more weeks
